Column Comment.0: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this facility license.
Column Comment.3: CONDITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the condition that is applied to thefacility license.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: FACILITY LICENSE CONDITION CODE: A validated code associated with a type ofcondition applied to the facility license.
Column Comment.6: FACILITY LICENSE CONDITION TYPE: the type of condition applied to the facilitylicense, such as flaring rate, venting rate, production rate, H2S content limit,emissions etc.
Column Comment.7: CONDITION VALUE: the value applied to this condition. For example, an NOXemmission limitation may be set at 0.02 kg / hr and the production rate for oil set at10 m3/day.
Column Comment.8: CONDITION VALUE UNIT OF MEASURE: the units of measure applied to thecondition value, often expressed as a rate such as m3/day or mol/kmol.
Column Comment.9: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: the unique identifier for the contact for thiscondition.
Column Comment.10: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.11: DESCRIPTION: Narrative descriptive remarks that accompany the license condition.Could include the definition at which the values apply (such as 101.325 kilopascalsand 15 degrees Celcius).
Column Comment.12: DUE CONDITION: The state that must be achieved for the condition to becomeeffective. For example, a report may be due 60 days after operations commence (orcease).
Column Comment.13: DUE DATE: The date that this condition must be fulfilled.
Column Comment.14: DUE FREQUENCY: the frequency with which this condition must be met, such as anannual review. Where conditions are cycling in this way, please use the project (forwork flow) or obligations ( for payments) module to track completions.
Column Comment.15: DUE TERM: the period within which this condition must be satisfied, usually followingcompletion of operations.
Column Comment.16: DUE TERM UNIT OF MEASURE: the unit of measure for the term, such as days,weeeks, months.
Column Comment.17: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.18: EXEMPT INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that the holder of the license is exemptfrom this condition.
Column Comment.19: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.20: FULFILLED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: unique identifier for the businessassociate who fulfilled this condition.
Column Comment.21: FULFILLED DATE: the date that this condition was fulfilled.
Column Comment.22: FULFILLED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this condition has been fulfilled.
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: RESTRICTION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a restriction.
Column Comment.27: RESTRICTION VERSION: The version number of the restriction. In some areas,changes to the detailed requirements of a restriction result in versioning.
Column Comment.28: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
